text:
Awesome. Thank you.
Thank you. Yeah, thank you! Thank you so much!
I'm never getting getting used to having fans.

The fact that they care so much to come see
me at a convention, to buy some of my printsâ€“ it means a lot to me.
When I first started I really didn't know

what I was doing. Like where to go, who to
meet.

Any person who's trying to promote themselves
it's not very easy to put yourself out there.

It's really easy to get overwhelmed.
This doesn't look bad! It looks pretty good

actually! It's surprising.
In total, last year I cosplayed like 20 characters.

I make about 80%-90% of mine.
And every year it gets more and more that
I make my own. Right before a convention, I could easily spend eight to ten, twelve hours
a day working on costumes on top of my eight-hour job.

I still get a decent amount of sleep.
It's everything else that I cut out of my life.

I cut out any recreation, I cut out
hanging with my friends.

I save all of my friend-hanging out at a convention.
But otherwise, I'm home, working on a costume.

Hey everyone! I just arrived in Singapore
last night at 2 am and it's about 8 am right now.
And I have to get ready for a press event later.
Having a really big online presence is really

important, and I work really hard to build
up my social media to create content that

people cared about.
And so, I just made sure to keep sharing all

my progress photos and my costumes.
I do a lot of photo shoots, and just have

a good, solid base of content that I'm posting
all the time.

Always doing stuff!
And, so having that presence really brought people to me.
In general, I break even.

At the end of the year I'll get all my expenses,
versus what I spent, and I break even, or
I am losing a few thousand. Everything we do is kind of freelance or just to promote ourselves.
There's no reason to put money into it right now.
But there's a lot of companies out there who

are realizing the importance of having cosplayers.
Our costumes are freakin' on point, we have

a fan base who follows us, very religiously
almost, that is very inspired by our costume making.
So they want to see it up close and stuff, not just want to take a picture of it. So that's really nice.
Nice to meet you! I am so excited to see you!
